title: SCS Bundle
description: Schema for SCS Bundle manifests. Bundles are container documents that organize and reference SCDs. They are NOT SCDs themselves - they are manifests similar to Docker container manifests or Kubernetes pod specs.

id.description: Unique bundle identifier using bundle: prefix (e.g., bundle:medication-adherence, bundle:architecture)

version.description: Semantic version (e.g., 1.0.0) or DRAFT for working bundles

description.description: Summary of what this bundle represents

imports.description: List of external bundle references with versions (e.g., bundle:architecture:1.0.0). Domain bundles import concern bundles. Concern bundles MUST have empty imports array.

items.description: Bundle reference with optional version (e.g., bundle:meta:1.0.0 or bundle:meta)

scds.description: List of SCD identifiers included directly in this bundle (not from imports). Project bundles typically have empty scds array.

created_by.description: Email or identifier of bundle creator

updated_by.description: Email or identifier of last updater

rationale.description: Explanation of why this bundle version was created or updated

imports.description: Concern bundles MUST NOT import other bundles - they contain only SCDs

scds.description: Concern bundles MUST contain at least one SCD

imports.description: Domain bundles MUST import at least one concern bundle

scds.description: Domain bundles import concerns, they do not directly contain SCDs

imports.description: Project bundles MUST import at least one bundle (typically meta, standards, and domain bundles)

scds.description: Meta bundles MUST contain at least one meta-tier SCD
Standards bundles may contain standards-tier SCDs or import other standards bundles

$comment: Bundle Types: project (top-level, imports all), meta (foundational vocabulary), standards (compliance requirements), concern (functional area), domain (industry vertical)
